p: Cinnamon, a compound obtained from different plant species from the genus Cinnamomum, is a source of many antiviral compounds in traditional Indian medicine [ 106]. Cinnamon extracts showed moderate inhibitory activity in wild-type severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV) and HIV/SARS-CoV S pseudovirus infections [ 88]. In a preliminary in silico study, 48 isolated compounds across all cinnamon species were subjected to docking analysis with the spike S protein and M pro of SARS-CoV-2. Teinufolin showed the highest binding affinity with M pro through six hydrogen interactions and hydrophobic interactions with two amino acids, and pavettanin C1 showed the highest binding affinity with the spike S protein through nine hydrogen and hydrophobic interactions with four amino acids [ 87].
